bill_title: To invite responsible gun owners from Virginia to relocate to South Dakota.

bill_versions.bill_text: A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION, To invite responsible gun owners from Virginia to relocate to South Dakota. WHEREAS, we the people of South Dakota have enshrined in our state Constitution the belief that all men are born equally free and independent, that all men have certain inherent rights, and that those rights include enjoying and defending life and liberty, acquiring and protecting property, and pursuing happiness; and WHEREAS, we the people of South Dakota have enshrined in our state Constitution the right to be secure in our persons, houses, papers and effects, against unreasonable searches and seizures; and WHEREAS, we the people of South Dakota have enshrined in our state Constitution the right to bear arms in defense of ourselves and the state; and WHEREAS, we the people of South Dakota live by the words of our Constitution--we value the rights granted to us by that document and by the second amendment to the Constitution of the United States; and WHEREAS, we the people of South Dakota value and jealously guard our right to keep and bear arms--a right that includes constitutional carry, capitol carry, and a long and proud tradition of hunting and participation in the shooting sports; and WHEREAS, we the people of South Dakota recognize that, in other states, such basic rights are under assault by governmental bodies more intent on infringing upon the freedom of their citizens than protecting and preserving it: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the Senate of the Ninety-Fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, the House of Representatives concurring therein, that we the people of South Dakota invite the responsible gunowners of the Commonwealth of Virginia to consider relocating to the 40th state where, in the shadow of Mount Rushmore, America's shrine of democracy, we will welcome you to experience our bustling cities and endless prairies, share in our crystal clear waters, play on our majestic hills, marvel at our unparalleled beauty and bounty, and absorb all that is our boundless wonder, and more importantly we will welcome you to live under the banner of unwavering support for the most precious rights and freedoms guaranteed to all by and through the United States Constitution and the Constitution of this state; and BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the secretary of the Senate arrange for copies of this resolution to be forwarded to the governor of the Commonwealth of Virginia, the president pro tempore of the Senate of Virginia, the speaker of the Virginia House of Delegates, and the editor of the Richmond Times Dispatch.
